name: A Lone Fire (VR)
description:
A Lone Fire
Room scale VR experience by Games or Whatever.

Made in 7 days for the Epic MegaJam 2017 
By Richard Ziegler and Trevor Dedekind.

What do you do?
Sit down, Let your eyes adjust to the night, Try to start a camp fire using sticks, kindling, a lighter, and the fire pit.
Lie and relax in artificial heat, cook things up, meet the forest spirit, play hide and seek, make music, dance, sleep if you want.

How do i play?
This is a Roomscale VR game, tested on a vive headset. Use the triggers to pick up and drop things, click the touch pad while holding lighter to spark it.
If your room is small, Hold the center of the touch pad to teleport, or rotate the room using the edge of the touchpad.

For the best experience

  1. Disable your vive camera.
  2. Set your chaperone bounds to developer in the vr dashboard settings.
  3.  If you have a GTX 1080, Press 5 to increase the resolution in game.
  4. Try not to teleport.

The game only takes 5 minutes, but feel free to stay as long as you like.

Assets used from outside the game jam.
Unreal starter content (some sound, rock, and modified grass, bushes, and particles)
sound effects from youtube audio library,
photoscaned log and rocks from megascans,
mushroom acorn lighter and sticks by Google on Poly.google.com .

Jam Build 1.0: GamesOrWhatever_ALoneFire.zip
Post Jam bug fix 1.1: GamesOrWhatever_ALoneFire1.1.zip
less accidental rotations during teleport, shrunk teleport bounds.
